<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 448, 785, 463]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 494, 504, 508]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 509, 380, 523]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 538, 907, 567]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 568, 907, 597]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 919, 107]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 920, 113]]<|/det|>
In a group of students, \(\frac{3}{4}\) are male. The proportion of male students who like their curry hot is \(\frac{3}{5}\) and the proportion of female students who like their curry hot is \(\frac{4}{5}\). One student is chosen at random.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 127, 156, 145]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 127, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the student chosen is either female, or likes their curry hot, or is both female and likes their curry hot. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 173, 920, 625]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 645, 154, 664]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 645, 920, 679]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 75, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
The volume of soup in Super Soup cartons has a normal distribution with mean \(\mu\) millilitres and standard deviation 9 millilitres. Tests have shown that \(10\%\) of cartons contain less than 440 millilitres of soup. Find the value of \(\mu\).

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 919, 108]]<|/det|>
In a certain country, \(60\%\) of mobile phones sold are made by Company \(A\), \(35\%\) are made by Company \(B\) and \(5\%\) are made by other companies.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 122, 156, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 122, 919, 154]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that, out of a random sample of 13 people who buy a mobile phone, fewer than 11 choose a mobile phone made by Company \(A\). [3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 168, 920, 520]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 541, 154, 560]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 542, 919, 575]]<|/det|>
